critiques.subject: Young woman wearing a beanie and layered shirt against a brick wall
improvements: [SUBTLE] Radial gradient exposure boost on face
preserve: The color harmony between the yellow sleeves and the brick tones
critiques.notes: The image has a solid foundation with nice color coordination, but suffers from flat lighting and a warm color cast. A tighter crop and white balance correction will significantly professionalize the result without altering the casual mood.

improvements_detailed.action: Crop inward from the left
improvements_detailed.reason: To remove excessive negative space and place the subject's eyes on the rule-of-thirds grid

improvements_detailed.action: Correct White Balance (reduce Temp)
improvements_detailed.reason: To neutralize the yellow/orange cast affecting the skin tones and white drawstrings

improvements_detailed.action: Increase Contrast and Clarity
improvements_detailed.reason: To fix the flat appearance and add separation between the subject and the textured wall

improvements_detailed.action: Radial gradient exposure boost on face
improvements_detailed.reason: To brighten the face slightly and draw attention to the eyes amidst the dark hair

improvements_detailed.action: Spot removal / Healing
improvements_detailed.reason: To clean up white lint specs on the dark t-shirt and distracting stray hairs

context.subject: Young woman wearing a beanie and layered shirt against a brick wall
preserve: The color harmony between the yellow sleeves and the brick tones

critiques.subject: A person in a beanie and layered hoodie/shirt posing against a brick wall, with wind-blown hair across the face
improvements: [MODERATE] Improve composition with a tighter crop (reduce excess space on the left/top), keeping the subject on the right third and maintaining comfortable headroom
[MODERATE] Apply selective sharpening/texture to the face and eyes (masking to skin/eyes only; avoid sharpening the brick), and add mild clarity to facial features
[SUBTLE] Reduce warm/orange saturation and luminance in the brick wall using HSL (or a background mask), and slightly darken the background with a subject mask inversion

[SUBTLE] Retouch distractions: remove/clone small wall blemishes and consider removing or toning down the sunglasses hanging at the chest; optionally tidy a few stray hairs crossing the mouth/cheek (light touch)
[SUBTLE] Refine tonal contrast with a gentle S-curve and lift shadows slightly on the face (local adjustment), while protecting highlights on the forehead/cheeks
preserve: The candid wind-blown feel and natural expression
The overall natural-light look without heavy skin smoothing
critiques.notes: The portrait has a relaxed, street-style vibe with pleasing exposure and low noise, but the subject’s face reads a bit soft and the brick wall is visually dominant. A tighter crop, targeted sharpening, and background toning will improve subject separation and make the face the clear focal point while maintaining the candid mood.

improvements_detailed.action: Improve composition with a tighter crop (reduce excess space on the left/top), keeping the subject on the right third and maintaining comfortable headroom
improvements_detailed.reason: The background brick wall dominates the frame; a tighter crop increases subject presence and strengthens portrait impact.

improvements_detailed.action: Apply selective sharpening/texture to the face and eyes (masking to skin/eyes only; avoid sharpening the brick), and add mild clarity to facial features
improvements_detailed.reason: Focus appears slightly soft on the face; targeted sharpening helps recover perceived detail without emphasizing background texture.

improvements_detailed.action: Reduce warm/orange saturation and luminance in the brick wall using HSL (or a background mask), and slightly darken the background with a subject mask inversion
improvements_detailed.reason: The warm brick competes with skin tones and the yellow clothing; toning it down improves separation and keeps attention on the subject.

improvements_detailed.action: Retouch distractions: remove/clone small wall blemishes and consider removing or toning down the sunglasses hanging at the chest; optionally tidy a few stray hairs crossing the mouth/cheek (light touch)
improvements_detailed.reason: Small distractions pull attention away from the face; minimal cleanup makes the portrait feel more intentional while staying natural.

improvements_detailed.action: Refine tonal contrast with a gentle S-curve and lift shadows slightly on the face (local adjustment), while protecting highlights on the forehead/cheeks
improvements_detailed.reason: Adds depth and improves facial readability without changing the casual, natural-light look.

preserve: The candid wind-blown feel and natural expression
